author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 11. Valāhakavagga
segments.en: 11. Clouds

segments.pli: 107. Mūsikasutta
segments.en: 107. Mice

segments.pli: “Catasso imā, bhikkhave, mūsikā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mice.

segments.pli: Katamā catasso?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Gādhaṃ kattā no vasitā, vasitā no gādhaṃ kattā, neva gādhaṃ kattā no vasitā, gādhaṃ kattā ca vasitā ca—
segments.en:
1. One makes a hole but doesn’t live in it,
  2. one lives in a hole but doesn’t make it,
  3. one neither makes a hole nor lives in it, and
  4. one both makes a hole and lives in it.

segments.pli: imā kho, bhikkhave, catasso mūsikā.
segments.en: These are the four kinds of mice.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro mūsikūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, these four people similar to mice are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Gādhaṃ kattā no vasitā, vasitā no gādhaṃ kattā, neva gādhaṃ kattā no vasitā, gādhaṃ kattā ca vasitā ca.
segments.en:
1. One makes a hole but doesn’t live in it,
  2. one lives in a hole but doesn’t make it,
  3. one neither makes a hole nor lives in it, and
  4. one both makes a hole and lives in it.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo gādhaṃ kattā hoti no vasitā?
segments.en: And how does a person make a hole but not live in it?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: It’s when a person memorizes the teaching—

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo gādhaṃ kattā hoti, no vasitā.
segments.en: That’s how a person makes a hole but doesn’t live in it.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, mūsikā gādhaṃ kattā, no vasitā;
segments.en: That person is like a mouse that makes a hole but doesn’t live in it, I say.

segments.pli: tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo vasitā hoti, no gādhaṃ kattā?
segments.en: And how does a person live in a hole but not make it?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dhammaṃ na pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: It’s when a person doesn’t memorize the teaching …

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo vasitā hoti, no gādhaṃ kattā.
Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, mūsikā vasitā hoti, no gādhaṃ kattā;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ, puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo neva gādhaṃ kattā hoti no vasitā?
segments.en: And how does a person neither make a hole nor live in it?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dhammaṃ na pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: It’s when a person doesn’t memorize the teaching …

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo neva gādhaṃ kattā hoti, no vasitā.
Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, mūsikā neva gādhaṃ kattā hoti, no vasitā;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo gādhaṃ kattā ca hoti vasitā ca?
segments.en: And how does a person both make a hole and live in it?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti—
segments.en: It’s when a person memorizes the teaching …

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo gādhaṃ kattā ca hoti vasitā ca.
Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, mūsikā gādhaṃ kattā ca hoti vasitā ca;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro mūsikūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These four people similar to mice are found in the world.”

segments.pli: Sattamaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mice.
